intro: Microseris nevadensis, commonly known as the Sierra Nevada salsify, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It is a member of the Brassicaceae family, which includes mustard and cabbage plants. The plant produces yellow flowers and has hairy, linear leaves. It typically grows in rocky or sandy soils in alpine and subalpine regions. Microseris nevadensis is adapted to cold climates and is often found in mountainous areas of Nevada and California.
